intro: Struthanthus portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Struthanthus portoricensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for nocturnal pollinators.
